title: Chile national rugby league team
text:
The Chile national rugby league team represents <a href="Chile">Chile</a> in <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a>. The team is operated by Futbol a 13 Chile and sanctioned by the <a href="Rugby%20League%20International%20Federation">Rugby League International Federation</a> to represent Chile at international level in the sport of rugby league.
History.
Rugby league (known locally as "Futbol a 13") was introduced to Chile in 2015 when the Futbol a 13 Chile organization was formed. Working in partnership with <a href="Latin%20Heat%20Rugby%20League">Latin Heat Rugby League</a>, an Australian-based expat team representing Chile competed in the <a href="Cabramatta%20International%20Nines">Cabramatta International Nines</a>, marking the first time a Chilean team participated in an organized rugby league competition.
The first domestic match in Chile was played in October 2016 in <a href="Negrete">Negrete</a>, which was followed by the announcement of the inaugural Chilean domestic competition. The competition was expanded with the Super Liga 13 Chile launching in 2017.
In November 2016, Chile competed in the inaugural international rugby league competition in South America, hosted in <a href="Miramar%2C%20Buenos%20Aires">Miramar</a>, <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>, comprising Chile, Argentina and a number of select sides from around the region which were supported by the <a href="Latin%20Heat%20Rugby%20League">Latin Heat</a> organization. The competition culminated in Argentina and Chile taking part in their first official international match, which Argentina won 16-0.
In November 2017, <a href="Los%20%C3%81ngeles%2C%20Chile">Los Ángeles, Chile</a> hosted the inaugural Latin American Rugby League Championship, comprising the national teams of Chile, Argentina, Colombia and Brazil. Chile won the inaugural tournament, defeating Argentina 32-12 in the final.
In November 2018 Chile participated in the <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rugby%20League%20Championship">2018 Americas Rugby League Championship</a>, which acted as the American <a href="2021%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20qualifying">qualifying competition</a> for the <a href="2021%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2021 Rugby League World Cup</a>; as such they became the first South American nation to enter the competition. They were eliminated after losing 62-0 to the <a href="United%20States%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">USA</a> on November 13, 2018.
Players.
Current squad.
Squad selected for <a href="2021%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20qualifying">2021 Rugby League World Cup qualifiers</a>;
